articles.headline: Carmakers Are Central Voice in U.S.-Europe Trade Talks
articles.snippet: Negotiations for a trans-Atlantic trade pact, which have failed to gain momentum for more than a year, resumed on Monday in Brussels.
articles.abstract: Negotiations for a trans-Atlantic trade pact, which have failed to gain momentum for more than a year, resumed on Monday in Brussels.
articles.lead_paragraph: DÜSSELDORF, Germany — It’s a task that makes sense only by the logic of international trade strictures — which is why negotiators for the European Union and the United States are eager to change the rule book.

articles.headline: A Focused Hunt for a Victim to Avenge Israelis’ Deaths
articles.snippet: Officials released new details about the killing of a Palestinian youth, saying that three Israeli Jews looked for hours for a victim to avenge the killings of three Israeli teenagers.
articles.abstract: Officials released new details about the killing of a Palestinian youth, saying that three Israeli Jews looked for hours for a victim to avenge the killings of three Israeli teenagers.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — They cruised around the Arab neighborhoods of East Jerusalem for hours in the dark of night, three Israeli Jews: a man of 29, who was driving, and two of his relatives, youths about 17. They were looking for a victim, preferably someone lightweight, who could easily be pushed into the car.

articles.headline: Yahoo Seeks to Bring the Concert to Your Couch
articles.snippet: The company plans to stream 365 live concerts for free, but music executives are skeptical there will be many viewers.
articles.abstract: The company plans to stream 365 live concerts for free, but music executives are skeptical there will be many viewers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Jacksonville Veterans Memorial Arena in Jacksonville, Fla., where the Dave Matthews Band is playing Tuesday night, can hold up to 15,000 people. But as Yahoo and Live Nation see it, the potential audience is limitless.

articles.headline: Reluctantly, Patriot Flees Homeland for Greener Tax Pastures
articles.snippet: Another company is moving its headquarters to Europe, in part to pay lower taxes. This time, it’s led by the daughter of a United States senator.
articles.abstract: Another company is moving its headquarters to Europe, in part to pay lower taxes. This time, it’s led by the daughter of a United States senator.
articles.lead_paragraph: Heather Bresch grew up around politics. Her father is Joe Manchin, the Democratic senator from West Virginia and a former governor. She has heard him say repeatedly, “We live in the greatest country on Earth,” as he did in countless political advertisements. And it appeared to rub off on her: Ms. Bresch was named a “Patriot of the Year” in 2011 by Esquire magazine for helping to push through the F.D.A. Safety Innovation Act.

articles.headline: Iran Outlines Nuclear Deal; Accepts Limit
articles.snippet: Iran’s foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, said the country could accept a freeze on its capacity to produce nuclear fuel at current levels for several years, provided it could eventually produce fuel unhindered.
articles.abstract: Iran’s foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, said the country could accept a freeze on its capacity to produce nuclear fuel at current levels for several years, provided it could eventually produce fuel unhindered.
articles.lead_paragraph: VIENNA — Iran’s chief nuclear negotiator, faced with an imminent deadline for an agreement with the West on the future of the country’s nuclear program, said in an interview on Monday that Iran could accept a deal that essentially freezes its capacity to produce nuclear fuel at current levels for several years, provided it is then treated like any other nation with a peaceful nuclear program.

articles.headline: Qatari Soccer Empire Buys a Foothold in Europe
articles.snippet: Through a program called Aspire Football Dreams, the Qataris had scouted hundreds of thousands of young African players; needing a place where the best youths could play professionally, they found it in a team in a small Belgian town.
articles.abstract: Through a program called Aspire Football Dreams, the Qataris had scouted hundreds of thousands of young African players; needing a place where the best youths could play professionally, they found it in a team in a small Belgian town.
articles.lead_paragraph: EUPEN, Belgium — In the southeast corner of Belgium, there is a town of about 20,000 that is known, to the extent it is known at all, as a key battleground during the Battle of the Bulge and, more recently, as the center of the tiny slice of this country that speaks German instead of French.
articles.byline: By Sam Borden, Steve Eder, Jack Williams and Christopher Harress
